Articles.Content:
The Orion launch today has been scrubbed!

Apparently it was a combination of high winds and a problem with the valves not closing. The launch is re-scheduled for tomorrow.

News:

http://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/the-switch/wp/2014/12/04/nasa-to-launch-orion-test-flight-thursday-morning/?Post+generic=%3Ftid%3Dsm_twitter_washingtonpost

Official NASA press release:

https://blogs.nasa.gov/orion/2014/12/04/managers-tap-friday-launch-attempt/

Friday has a 40% right weather conditions, which is less than today (60%).

Edited December 4, 2014 by Engineer Of Stuff
Scrubbed, not cancelled. (Duh!)
My first reaction was "Aw, man!" But in hindsight I guess I want them to be sure they're ready.
Why do we need yet another thread on this? The mods just went through and merged the 3 or 4 other Orion launch threads into one... Maybe they like playing "whack-a-mole", but maybe they don't?

Not cancelled, scrubbed.

It has been rescheduled.

I've run back home for nothing... you know what was cancelled? My lunch.

Moreover, my KSP career has rescheduled, since I'm affected by a bad launchpad Kraken...

I see what the problem is, by the looks of the new launcher... they went full KSP and Asparagus!

http://www.theregister.co.uk/2014/12/04/orion_launch_scrubbed/

I looks like mos of my failed small launchers!
Well I just wasted 400MB of data on my cell network an went over the limit watching NASA TV all day.

I have just returned so ask me what happened on my thread simply since Im too tired to bother with managing 3 different threads on the same topic. So if theres something you want clarification on or whatever ask me there and I'll respond OR at 3:30pm EST if anyone wants me to- I'll jump on my private IRC server and we can chat live time there instead. Your choice.
